s.text: Within the outcrop (which is actually the ÒSkull HillÓ of the Garden Tomb) is a cave called JeremiahÕs Grotto; it is believed that the Prophet Jeremiah wrote the Book of Lamentations here and was then laid to rest.
Stained-glass windows add to the calm and peaceful atmosphere, especially when worshippers are at quiet prayer: be careful not to walk in front of those at prayer.

The rock is surrounded by a richly worked wooden screen, and above it are stained-glass windows and black-and-gold mosaics, breathtaking in their beauty.
